title: Where is line number added
message_prompt: In the code you see, where did I insert line numbers into code message string?
message_edit:
You inserted line numbers into the code message string in the `get_code_message` method of the `CodeFeature` class, specifically within the loop that iterates over the file lines. This is done conditionally based on whether the parser is configured to provide line numbers.

Here is the relevant code snippet from the `mentat/code_feature.py` file:

```python
143:        # Get file lines
144:        file_lines = code_file_manager.read_file(self.path)
145:        for i, line in enumerate(file_lines):
146:            if self.interval.contains(i + 1):
147:                if parser.provide_line_numbers():
148:                    code_message.append(
149:                        f"{i + parser.line_number_starting_index()}:{line}"
150:                    )
151:                else:
152:                    code_message.append(f"{line}")
```

In this snippet, line numbers are inserted into the code message string at lines 148-149. If the parser is set to provide line numbers, each line of the code message is prefixed with the line number and a colon, followed by the actual line of code. The line number is calculated by adding the loop index `i` to the `parser.line_number_starting_index()`.
